text: Aug 12 Canadas main stock index opened higher on Wednesday lifted by energy stocks which tracked higher oil prices, as a drop in U.S. crude inventories raised hopes for a recovery in demand.* At 09:30 a.m. ET (1330 GMT), the Toronto Stock Exchanges S&P/TSX composite index was up 158.01 points, or 0.96%, at 16,655.02. (Reporting by Shivani Kumaresan in Bengaluru; Editing by Amy Caren Daniel)
